story:
Hello everyone,

Someone once told me, "shoot for the stars b/c you never know how far you might go!" so, after hearing about this opportunity, I thought about aiming high & giving this a try as well. I believe I have the next biggest household name brand/logo, especially having a well-known designer who works with Oprah to back me up. Let's beginning, shall we?

 

First and foremost, my name is Robert E. Lubin, I'm 25 years
old and I live in Seattle, Washington. I am the CEO/Creator of the brand(s)
Fresh Kics LLC, Forever Fresh & Fly, & Beautiful Fresh & Fly. Fresh
Kics Founded December 2010 in Spokane, Washington, can be defined by the shoe
aspect of the brand, and the clothing line brand Forever Fresh and Fly (3FFF),
Founded November 2013 in Seattle, can be defined by the apparel and accessories
aspect of the brand Fresh Kics is a “fresh” product. How many time have you
logged on a computer and typed in "Fresh Kicks" into the search
engine just to find a whole bunch of so called "Fresh Kicks" products
such as Jordan's, Nikes, Reebok, etc... But never an actual name brand that's
actually called for what it is? It's the same way when walking anywhere and
someone stop to ask you, "Where you get them Fresh Kicks from?" So,
why not start a brand with the actual name with a well-known shoe designer?! By
using the word “fresh”, it can mean many things: the way they fit, the way they
look, the way they make a customer feel while wearing them, and the ability to
be unique, fresh and fly. The creator and team wants people to instantly question
when they stumble upon this brand is: what is Fresh Kics, who created this
ingenious idea, where they can buy them, how much the product is, and how quick
they can get to feeling fresh in their own pair of Fresh Kics shoes or Fresh
Kics product.

We’ve had a rare opportunity to have a renown shoe designer
come on board with us by the name, Mark Schwartz, who is known as a
Professional Shoe designer & Painter. He is and has been the
designer/creator behind our brand Fresh Kics since 2011. Mark has truly blessed
us with his gift through the aspect of designs & prototypes he has done for
this company. We believe with Mark on our team Fresh Kics will soon make
history and one day we will be the next biggest household name brand such as
Nike, Adidas, Reebok, etc. We’re currently working on getting some new
prototypes done with his connects in Europe that will be bringing something
new, but also Fresh & Fly to the market. “Sure, Mark Schwartz is Oprah's favorite shoe designer. Of course he worked with Vivier and hung with Warhol. And yeah, he's designed footwear for Ralph and Calvin. But take away his twenty year design career and his impressive list of one-name friends and what have you got? Well, you have one world-class artist, for starters.” (http://shoes.about.com/od/footwear/a/mark_schwartz.htm)

“For over 30 years, Mark has been churning out unique and
interesting designs of shoes; an accessory that he considers to be the most
artistic and important. His shoe designs have graced the runways of Paris,
Milan and New York as well as the pages of many fashion publications such as
Vogue, Elle, W and many more.

 

Mission statement:  By using the terminology “fresh,” it can
be defined by how the products fit, the way they look, the way they make the
customer feel while wearing them. Overall, it’s the ability to be unique, fresh
and fly. Hence our mission statement; To empower, build and unite communities, and give hope through fashion statements, that anything is possible. We want to target the youth and be that seed of inspiration, faith, hope, encouragement, through our Shoes and Apparel. Our long term goal is to be the next biggest fashion
household name on the market, and to be recognized through our shoe and apparel
line, as well as our unique logo.


SWOT Analysis:

Our Strength
despite being a startup company, we have quickly gained ground via our 3 online
stores, with some of our apparel being sold out. We have statistics on social
media and have reached over 17 countries so far.
Our Weakness
is the cost of capital. A good brand without marketing is nothing. We need
funds to be pumped in to Marketing, Production and general overheads to support
our current sales and future promotions.

The Opportunity
we have is our target market has a wide age range (Babies-to-adults) who love
the latest fashion trends. Ladies can’t have enough pairs of shoes, and guys
alike will always want that fresh tee or hat. We intend to expand our line in
to perfumes and colognes, lady purses and accessories once our brand breaks
ground.

Our main Threat
is big name competitors in the fashion industry, which through the help of
celebrity endorsers. We do have a few celebs in our gear on our social networks
such as Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter, we are beginning to close the gap and
gain great recognition.

Stage of development: We are marketing our brand by word of
the mouth, and via social networks. We already have production going on, we have a shoe designer Mark Schwartz and 3 on line stores and already tapping the market.

Products and services: Our main product is the shoe line (Sneakers), of which we have proto types, but due to the cost of production it’s on hold. Nevertheless, we have a wide assortment of apparel ranging from bennies, tees, hats, hoodies just to mention a few, some of which are sold out on line, and others have been given out to celebrities who have showcased them on Facebook and other social media.

Target Market: Our Market is an open playing field
that spots all races, creed, color, age groups, sex, nationalities, and or
religion. We intend to have the latest and greatest fashion trends to appeal to
this group through our different products and fashion in our shoes and apparel. So far, we have had everyone from ages 5-60years old rocking our brand and purchasing more than twice from us as products get better and better. We had nothing but great feedbacks every time we sold a product to any of our consumers.

 

Marketing and Sales Strategy: Our main focus, at the moment, is to grow
as a team, focusing on both our short and long term goals. Fresh Kics LLC
is providing a global platform of branding to the fashion industry. Not only
are we branding our company by distributing our products through retail locations and online stores, but we have a marketing system that will utilize Original Equipment Manufacturer “O.E.M.” deals, that will place us in more markets then the traditional clothing market. We plan to secure a number of "O.E.M” deals that will
upgrade our current clothing and shoe products as well as creating new products to enter into other industries. We also intend to diversify our products;


For example: Fresh Kics is currently teaming up with Graham at Maxonix (div Arovox LLC) to get placement on their new development series of drumstick bags and drum cases which will include our logo, as well as teaming up with the number 1 drumstick company in the world "Promark" to revolutionize the stick bag
industry by creating a luxury brand of drumstick bags. 

Endorsers: Here at Fresh Kics we understand the value of having endorsers to promote our products in a global manner. Our Marketing President, Jovan Dawkins, is a very successful musician, music producer, A&R. With his relationships we are planning to get connected  with celebrity endorsers thus far in the field
of film, Music, sports, modeling, Fashion Stylists who are pushing our brand to
date, and will provide product placement such as photo shoots for major
magazines, media commercials on national television, social media promo etc.

Management: As of right now, we have a small group of helpers on our team, but we plan to grow from here on out with a strong staff of people with respective talent, who will be coming on board. Also, as a startup company with restricted funds, this team doubles up in roles, but we consult a lot with industry experts and also have secured a company attorney.

 

Our plan for the Money we are seeking is for:

1) Clothing
Manufacturing  $250,000

2) Trademark new names for high class luxury products 

 $550 dollars for new TM name & $250
dollars for the LLC

3) Shoe manufacturing "Fresh Kics"

 600 pairs to start off (Priced at $100 per sample to start off) = $60,000 (subject to change and break down cost of samples to be made,
sold each, & manufactured) 

4) Cost for Patent on sneakers once develop

Prototypes   $1,050each * 20 = $21,000

5) Stick bags manufacturing (Good market to target with unique logo in hand)

 $35,000
6) Office for when we starting hiring process down the road & creating job opportunities   
Space (North Hollywood Ca.) Securing lease payments for 2years

$6,500 * 24months = $156,000
7) Commercial building/office supplies/computers/furniture/Insurance policy/etc…  $150,000
8) Traveling Expenses/meetings/etc…

 $60,000

9) Promo Expenses/ Events/Photo Shoot/Commercial/ Endorsement Expenses/Fashion Shows/etc…

 $400,000

10) Marketing with Universal

 $450,000 (That’s marketing for both
sneakers/clothing)

Total amount we are seeking for these projects together is:

$2,271,000- $2.3 million (Round it).

 

Or we can start on a smaller scale of just sneaker development, cost, marketing, fashion, traveling, etc...

 

1) Traveling
Expenses/meetings/etc…

$60,000

2) Cost for designs

$2,000 depend on what we aiming for and how many designs from our designers

3) Cost to make samples/prototypes to be made in Europe 

$700each (varies on type of sneaker we trying to create)

4) Marketing (varies on the type of company we aim to work with)

$75,000-250,000

 Total= $137,700

 

This opens up many doors to help branch name brand out to celebrities and gain you lots of exposure & cash flow.

 

 Anyone can help by donating, sharing it with friends, pointing us to investors or investing yourself, etc... We want to help create jobs in the future for those who really need doors open to them and want to develop their skills in business & fashion. The fashion world is an ongoing business that can grow into something amazing & help a lot of people who want to do the work but have fun with it at the same time.

 
 Exit Strategy: Our exit strategy is contingent upon our brand recognition that we are going to build and promote aggressively in the first phase, with the help of celebrity endorsers that Jovan (Marketing President) has already secured. (Jovan has either worked for or with them directly) and through business connections was able to pitch Fresh Kics as a brand that will have a good will value for sale along other acquired assets at the time.

 

Websites: To Shop

http://Foreverfreshandfly.spreadshirt.com (Main site now for all
exclusive products)

http://Foreverfreeshandfly.bigcartel.com (Clothing site before Spread
Shirt site)

Social Network:

http://instagram.com/foreverfreshandfly (Clothing)

http://instagram.com/myfreshkics (Sneakers)

https://www.facebook.com/foreverfreshandfly (Facebook)

https://www.facebook.com/freshkicsFKT (Facebook)
story_txt:
Hello everyone, Someone once told me, "shoot for the stars b/c you never know how far you might go!" so, after hearing about this opportunity, I thought about aiming high & giving this a try as well. I believe I have the next biggest household name brand/logo, especially having a well-known designer who works with Oprah to back me up. Let's beginning, shall we?  First and foremost, my name is Robert E. Lubin, I'm 25 yearsold and I live in Seattle, Washington. I am the CEO/Creator of the brand(s)Fresh Kics LLC, Forever Fresh & Fly, & Beautiful Fresh & Fly. FreshKics Founded December 2010 in Spokane, Washington, can be defined by the shoeaspect of the brand, and the clothing line brand Forever Fresh and Fly (3FFF),Founded November 2013 in Seattle, can be defined by the apparel and accessoriesaspect of the brand Fresh Kics is a “fresh” product. How many time have youlogged on a computer and typed in "Fresh Kicks" into the searchengine just to find a whole bunch of so called "Fresh Kicks" productssuch as Jordan's, Nikes, Reebok, etc... But never an actual name brand that'sactually called for what it is? It's the same way when walking anywhere andsomeone stop to ask you, "Where you get them Fresh Kicks from?" So,why not start a brand with the actual name with a well-known shoe designer?! Byusing the word “fresh”, it can mean many things: the way they fit, the way theylook, the way they make a customer feel while wearing them, and the ability tobe unique, fresh and fly. The creator and team wants people to instantly questionwhen they stumble upon this brand is: what is Fresh Kics, who created thisingenious idea, where they can buy them, how much the product is, and how quickthey can get to feeling fresh in their own pair of Fresh Kics shoes or FreshKics product.We’ve had a rare opportunity to have a renown shoe designercome on board with us by the name, Mark Schwartz, who is known as aProfessional Shoe designer & Painter. He is and has been thedesigner/creator behind our brand Fresh Kics since 2011. Mark has truly blessedus with his gift through the aspect of designs & prototypes he has done forthis company. We believe with Mark on our team Fresh Kics will soon makehistory and one day we will be the next biggest household name brand such asNike, Adidas, Reebok, etc. We’re currently working on getting some newprototypes done with his connects in Europe that will be bringing somethingnew, but also Fresh & Fly to the market. “Sure, Mark Schwartz is Oprah's favorite shoe designer. Of course he worked with Vivier and hung with Warhol. And yeah, he's designed footwear for Ralph and Calvin. But take away his twenty year design career and his impressive list of one-name friends and what have you got? Well, you have one world-class artist, for starters.” (http://shoes.about.com/od/footwear/a/mark_schwartz.htm) “For over 30 years, Mark has been churning out unique andinteresting designs of shoes; an accessory that he considers to be the mostartistic and important. His shoe designs have graced the runways of Paris,Milan and New York as well as the pages of many fashion publications such asVogue, Elle, W and many more.  Mission statement:  By using the terminology “fresh,” it canbe defined by how the products fit, the way they look, the way they make thecustomer feel while wearing them. Overall, it’s the ability to be unique, freshand fly. Hence our mission statement; To empower, build and unite communities, and give hope through fashion statements, that anything is possible. We want to target the youth and be that seed of inspiration, faith, hope, encouragement, through our Shoes and Apparel. Our long term goal is to be the next biggest fashionhousehold name on the market, and to be recognized through our shoe and apparelline, as well as our unique logo. SWOT Analysis:Our Strengthdespite being a startup company, we have quickly gained ground via our 3 onlinestores, with some of our apparel being sold out. We have statistics on socialmedia and have reached over 17 countries so far. Our Weaknessis the cost of capital. A good brand without marketing is nothing. We needfunds to be pumped in to Marketing, Production and general overheads to supportour current sales and future promotions.The Opportunitywe have is our target market has a wide age range (Babies-to-adults) who lovethe latest fashion trends. Ladies can’t have enough pairs of shoes, and guysalike will always want that fresh tee or hat. story:
Ich sammel  für meinen Sohn Florian, um seinen Traum  von einem Relax und Auszeitraum zu verwirklichen und  ev.  für den Garten ein großes Trampolin.

Auf den ersten Blick sieht er aus, wie ein normaler gesunder Junge, Er ist intelligent, zurückhaltend und  9 Jahre alt.

Aber er ist Autist.

Zudem hat er eine Form des Mutismus (d.h. er spricht in bestimmten Situationen nichtmal mit mir und  nicht immer mit jedem Menschen) und er hat zusätzlich adhs.

Dadurch hat er nur sehr wenige Sozialkontakte, sein liebstes Hobby ist der PC , Vorallem Landwirtschaftssimulatoren  und Minecraft haben es ihm angetan.

Damit er sich, wenn es ihm zu viel wird, zurückziehen kann oder er auch seine angestauten Emotionen los werden kann, würden wir ihm gerne in seinem Zimmer einen extra Raum einrichten,

Dazu wären zuätzliche Wände nötig, es soll ein Boxsack aufgehängt werden,  sowie eine kleine Zone mit Kissen, in die er sich einkuscheln und zur Ruhe kommen kann.

Auf dem Trampolin im Garten könnte er sich zusätzlich auspowern ohne in einer Gruppe Sport machen zu müssen,

Zur Zeit wohnen wir noch im 1.OG eines Mehrfamilienhauses. Wir sind gerade dabei ein Haus zu bauen, in dem er die Nachbarn nicht mehr stören kann, wenn er mal wieder überfordert ist und brüllt oder trampelt. Oder einfach morgens schon früh wach ist und einen schlechten Start in den Tag hat.

Leider sind jetzt innerhalb kurzer Zeit unsere Autos defekt gewesen, ohne die wir nicht zur Arbeit kommen und schon gar nicht zu den Therapien mit meinem Sohn bzw mit seiner 11 jährigen Schwester. Somit mußten wir leider das für seinen Raum gesparte Geld für die Reperaturen ausgeben.

Bitte helft uns seinen Traum zu verwirklichen! Jeder Cent hilft


I collect for my son Florian to realize his dream of a relaxing and time out room and ev. for the garden, a large trampoline.
At first glance it looks like a normal healthy boy, he is intelligent, cautious and 9 years old.
But  he is autistic.
He also has a form of mutism (ie he speaks in certain situations, not even with me, and not always with each man) and he has adhd addition. As a result, he has very few social contacts, his favorite hobby is the PC especially Agriculture simulators and Minecraft have it done to him.
So that it does when it is too much to him, may withdraw or he can get rid of his pent-up emotions, we would like to set him in his room an extra room,
These walls Complementary services would be required, it shall be a punching bag to be hung, and a small area with cushions, in which he snuggle and be at peace.On the trampoline in the garden he could enjoy a workout in addition without having to make a group sport,
Currently we  live on the 1st floor of an apartment building. We are in the process of building a house in which he can no longer disturb the neighbors when he is overwhelmed again and yells or trampling.  within a short time our cars have been broken, without which we would not come to work and not to the therapies with my son and his 11 year old sister. Thus, we unfortunately had to spend the  money for the repairs.

Please help us to realize his dream! 


Je collecte des fonds afin de pouvoir réaliser le rêve de mon fils Florian d´une salle de jeu ou il pourra aussi se détendre, ainsi qu´éventuellement un grand trampoline pour notre jardin.

Au premier regard il a tout d´un garçon comme les autres. Il a 9 ans, est intelligent et timide. Mais il est autiste. Il est également atteint d´un forme de mutisme, ce qui veut dire que dans certaines situations il ne me parle pas et pas toujours à tout le monde. Il a aussi un trouble de l´attention avec de l´hyperactivité.

De ce fait il n´a que peu de contact avec les gens qui l´entourent. Son loisir favori est l´ordinateur, notamment des jeux tels que Minecraft. Afin qu´il puisse se retirer lorsqu´il accumule un trop plein d´émotions, nous souhaiterions lui construire une pièce supplémentaire dans sa chambre. Pour ce faire, des murs supplémentaires sont nécessaires. Nous aimerions accrocher un sac de box et aménager un coin avec des coussins dans lesquels il pourra se blottir et reprendre son calme. Il pourrait également se dépenser sans nécessairement faire du sport en groupe. Actuellement nous vivons au premier étage d´une maison familiale. Nous sommes cependant en train de laisser construire notre maison, ou il ne pourra plus déranger les voisins car il crie et piétine lorsqu´il est dépassé par ses émotions ou simplement lorsque sa journée a mal commencé.

Malheureusement, nos voitures respectives sont tombées en panne l´une après l´autre en très peu de temps. Nous en avons besoin pour aller travailler, mais aussi pour amener Florian et sa sœur de 11 ans aux séances de thérapie. Nous avons donc été obligés d´utiliser l´argent économisé pour le rêve de Florian afin de pouvoir faire réparer les voitures. S´il vous plait, aidez-nous à réaliser son rêve.

Chaque centime compte!

story:
WHO ARE WE?
Vegeria is a grass roots vegan restaurant. The first of its kind in San Antonio. Taking the Lone Star state by storm with fresh plant-based Tex-Mex and Latino cuisine. 

OUR PROJECT:
Vegeria is adding a second restaurant called ¡Viva Vegeria! to share its healthy options with the diverse population of San Antonio. Vegeria aims to feed the masses and educate the city on issues like cultural preservation through food, healthy eating, urban gardening, farm-to-table movement, and organic seasonal farming. 

In it’s larger location with a beautiful shaded outdoor patio setting, ¡Viva Vegeria! will continue to value and promote its rich Mexicano and Tejano roots. ¡Viva Vegeria! will be located at 1422 Nogalitos in San Antonio, Texas. 

¡Viva Vegeria! was established as a result of business partner Mark Voelkel and Vegeria founder Chef Fred Anthony Garza teaming together to make a difference in the San Antonio community. 

Our key principle is the need to preserve the food of our ancestors and the indigenous food of the land. Chef Fred Anthony Garza believes our diet has changed, but our culture hasn't. We want to preserve our family's traditions of food, love and culture in a noble and ethical way. We want our children to know the recipes of our grandparents, and the love in which we all come from. 

Fred was inspired by his grandmas recipes, legacy, and love. He wants to share that with a new generation of people. "If we don't keep cooking the food of our ancestors no one will. If we want our children and  grandchildren to know what real Tex-Mex food is we must keep creating it, sharing it and serving it, and letting it evolve. We must be proud of our food and culture." 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

Vegeria in it’s current location has had challenges with visibility both in terms of the building and signage. As Vegeria has increased business and the number of customers we serve. We have found more  limitations have surfaced such as parking lot size, available amount of tables, and kitchen size for food preparation. We are confident we can overcome these limitations with our new location and a loyal customer-base. The new location has many advantages for attracting new customers. Furthermore we are proud to bring our plant-based food to the south side of San Antonio.

SUCCESS:

In our short 4 year history. Vegeria has grown in business and also been recognized for it’s success. This includes:

  • 2012: Voted one of the top 10 new restaurants in San Antonio by the San Antonio Magazine
  • 2013-2014 : Nominated as one of top vegan restaurants in the USA Today
  • 2013: Nominated for best Casual Vegan Restaurant in Veg News
  • 4 time finalist for “Best of SA (San Antonio)” by The San Antonio Current 

Additionally,  Chef Fred Anthony has been recognized by Veg News, Vegetarian Times, The San Antonio Current, and Texas monthly. He has also appeared on several local TV stations. 

YOUR PARTICIPATION BUILDS A PATH TO THE FUTURE

What do we plan on doing with the funds? We plan on creating educational  programs each quarter, to teach vegan and gluten free cooking at no cost. We want to buy more high chairs, and booster seats for the kids we serve. We also need a few more kitchen tools to help crank out food safely, and quickly. We need two more prep tables to create nutritious food. A mixer for our bakery, to bake more delicious goods. We would also like to purchase additional outdoor tables, and chairs to have customers enjoy our patio. 
We want to make sure we to offer quality experiences. We also want to make sure to pay our employees a living wage. Not only do we want to feed hungry crowds, we want to help improve our community with good jobs, healthy eating and education. Every dollar helps. We have some great perks for donors

We hope to keep sharing, and improving the lives of our community for years to come. However we need your help. Together we make a difference. A difference in our health, culture, the lives of animals, and to San Antonio. Our plans is to keep learning, and serving compassionate, and loving Comida Latina.
story_txt:
WHO ARE WE?Vegeria
 is a grass roots vegan restaurant. The first of its kind in San 
Antonio. Taking the Lone Star state by storm with fresh plant-based Tex-Mex and Latino cuisine. 

OUR PROJECT:Vegeria is adding a second restaurant called ¡Viva Vegeria!

 to
 share its healthy options with the diverse population of San Antonio. 
Vegeria aims to feed the masses and educate the city on issues like 
cultural preservation through food, healthy eating, urban gardening, 
farm-to-table movement, and organic seasonal farming. 

In it’s larger location with a beautiful shaded outdoor patio setting, ¡Viva Vegeria! will continue to value and promote its rich Mexicano and Tejano roots. ¡Viva Vegeria! will be located at 1422 Nogalitos in San Antonio, Texas. 
¡Viva Vegeria! was established as a result of business partner Mark Voelkel and Vegeria founder Chef Fred Anthony Garza teaming together to make a difference in the San Antonio community. 

Our key principle is the need to preserve the food of our ancestors and the indigenous food of the land. Chef Fred Anthony Garza believes our diet
 has changed, but our culture hasn't. We want to preserve our family's 
traditions of food, love and culture in a noble and ethical way. We want
 our children to know the recipes of our grandparents, and the love in 
which we all come from. 
Fred
 was inspired by his grandmas recipes, legacy, and love. He wants to 
share that with a new generation of people. "If we don't keep cooking 
the food of our ancestors no one will. If we want our children and 
 grandchildren to know what real Tex-Mex food is we must keep creating 
it, sharing it and serving it, and letting it evolve. We must be proud 
of our food and culture." 
RISKS AND CHALLENGES:
Vegeria in it’s current location has had challenges with visibility both in terms of the building and signage. As Vegeria has increased business and the number of customers we serve. We have found more  limitations have surfaced such as parking lot size, available amount of tables, and kitchen size for food preparation. We are confident we can overcome these limitations with our new location and a loyal customer-base. The new location has many advantages for attracting new customers. Furthermore we are proud to bring our plant-based food to the south side of San Antonio. 
SUCCESS:
In our short 4 year history. Vegeria has grown in business and also been recognized for it’s success. This includes:

2012: Voted one of the top 10 new restaurants in San Antonio by the San Antonio Magazine
2013-2014 : Nominated as one of top vegan restaurants in the USA Today
2013: Nominated for best Casual Vegan Restaurant in Veg News
4 time finalist for “Best of SA (San Antonio)” by The San Antonio Current 


Additionally,
  Chef Fred Anthony has been recognized by Veg News, Vegetarian Times, 
The San Antonio Current, and Texas monthly. He has also appeared on several 
local TV stations.

years to come. However we need your help. Together we make a difference.

loving Comida Latina.

story:
Our Cancer Story...

My name is Joshua Vickers and the owner of MASSO Whole Body Therapeutics in Denver, Colorado.  My life changed 2 years ago when my 32 year old sister, and mother of two children, was diagnosed with stage 4 rectal cancer.  Within one year she suffered a metastasis to her lungs and spine. Thankfully her treatments have been successful in regards to minimizing cancer. However, her body was deteriorated while undergoing chemotherapy and radiation.  Treatment left her in a wheel chair, requiring constant oxygen, and unable to enjoy life even though her cancer was "getting better."  In January 2015 I decided this does not have to be the life of a cancer thriver or survivor.  Science clearly explains "movement is life" and if we guide cancer patients through proper exercise and rehabilitation, then healing becomes possible and life becomes enjoyable.  In April 2015 my sister now has the ability to take walks with her family, pick her kids up from school, walk around the zoo, and attend her son and daughter's sporting events. My sister is still undergoing chemotherapy; however she no longer is losing out on her family memories. 
 
We have developed a program lead by a Medical Doctor utilizing Private Pilates Rehabilitation, Yoga Therapy, Acupuncture, Physical Therapy, Chiropractic, and Nutritional Guidelines specifically suited to each clients' individual needs.  

We wish to change the nature of the cancer experience following the diagnosis with Whole Body Exercise Rehabilitation for those currently receiving treatment or have completed treatment. We want to work with those fighting cancer and their oncologists to develop a holistic program to minimize the side effects of cancer treatments. 


The Plan...

Funding will go towards the development of a Whole Body Exercise Rehabilitation Center for Cancer.  Our facilities will be professional, private, and comfortable. The installation of state of the art rehabilitation equipment in private exercise and treatment rooms the accommodations necessary to meet the needs of all caner patients.  

Our business will also institute a mentor program and community outreach support group for those with cancer to share their experiences during their quest for recovery and strive to help others with a similar diagnosis.  Mentors will be able to visit others during chemotherapy, at their homes and during their rehabilitation sessions to provide encouragement and support to keep fighting. 

Our office will also be developing a non-profit organization to raise money and make Exercise Rehabilitation accessible for those with limited resources. 

Our long term goal is the development of Whole Body Cancer Rehabilitation Centers in multiple states.  Help us make this happen. 


Opportunity...

Whole body exercise rehabilitation is being studied more and more in recent years and these studies have proven, movement helps improve the quality of life for all cancer patients. Currently, the options for those fighting cancer to learn about how exercise can help their recovery are extremely limited. We will become the number one source for cancer patients to learn about and experience the benefits of movement during their battle with cancer. 


It's time to give someone with cancer a chance to rebuild and enjoy their life.

story:
Mateo and his family are struggling to raise 6000usd to provide him with an oxygen backpack so he can carry it around instead of the tank, helping him to move around freely.

SPANISH: Mateo es un niño oriundo de Juan de Mena. Padece de una insuficiencia pulmonar cronica , progresiva y lo vuelve oxigeno dependiente.
Su madre clama nuestro solidario aporte hasta obtener la suma de 6000,oo U$ para la compra de un concentrador de oxigeno en forma de mochila a bateria.
ENGLISH: Mateo is a boy from Juan de Mena, a poor town in Paraguay. He suffers from a chronic, progressive lung failure and that makes him oxygen-dependent.
His mother cries our solidarity contribution, they need the sum of 6000,oo USD to purchase an oxygen concentrator backpack..

Mateo and his family don't know me, or you, or any of us who are going to help them.

ESPAÑOL: Mateo y su familia no sabe quien soy yo, ni vos, ni ninguno de los que vamos a ayudarle. Vi varias publicaciones en Facebook de personas que piden ayudar a este chico, entonces decidí empezar esta campaña con la intención de "sorprenderlos" todos juntos con nuestra ayuda. 
Necesitamos seis mil dólares para ayudarlo. Estuve viendo y lo más adecuado parece ser el Phillips Respironics Simply Go, Concentrador de Oxigeno Portátil. Si saben de alguno mejor, su sugerencia es más que bienvenida.

ENGLISH: I saw many Facebook posts of people asking for help, so I decided to start this campaign and kind of surprise them with the new oxygen backpack. 

We need 6000usd (six thousand dollars) to help him. I'll look for a Phillips Respironics Simply Go, Portable Oxygen Concentrator. If you know of a better one, your suggestion will be more than welcome. 

Let's all get together and change this little boy's life. Just because :)

Unámonos todos y ayudemos a cambiar la vida de este nene. Porque sí :)

story:
About Us


Hi, we are the Swansons and we reside in the beautiful state of Vermont.  We've always been pretty health and environmentally conscious people.  We always eat our veggies, exercise, recycle and try to keep waste to a minimum.  However, around the same time our son was born, we realized how necessary it is to really know where our food comes from and how it is raised/farmed.  We became frustrated with how difficult it was to actually have access to healthy, organic, unprocessed foods.   During our research, we also discovered that the way many foods are grown/raised, especially meat, causes a lot of harm to our planet.  So, with our health, our beautiful planet and our children's futures in mind, we challenged ourselves to live an even healthier lifestyle and demonstrate even better earth-friendly habits by thinking outside the box.  We opened our eyes to a solution that has been in front of us all along - insects.  Specifically, crickets.  


The Problem

( Above is an image of a massive feedlot.  The pond in the middle is animal waste.)

The livestock sector occupies 70% of all agricultural land and 30% of the land surface of the planet.  It is one of the major contributors to global warming, contributing over 18% of all greenhouse gas emissions, a higher share than the transport sector (One study puts this number at 51%).  It is the largest source of water pollution and a major player in antibiotic and pesticide use.

To quote from 'Livestocks Long Shadow (a report released by the FAO in 2006)'

‘The livestock sector emerges as one of the top two or three most significant contributors to the most serious environmental problems, at every scale from local to global.  The findings of this report suggest that it should be a major policy focus when dealing with problems of land degradation, climate change and air pollution, water shortage and water pollution and loss of biodiversity.’

Realizing the way in which we raise the animals that we eat is destroying the planet, was a wake-up call for us.  We started looking for alternative sources of protein.  The answer came in the form of a paper written by the FAO.

Before we talk about crickets, we would like to admit that we aren't vegetarians (we've tried, but failed), and we don't want to get rid of the livestock industry all together.  We are fortunate enough to live in Vermont, and have access to meat that has been raised in the best way possible.  This is what we want for the rest of the country (and the world).  However, even if we focus on quality over quantity when it comes to meat, we need to realize that we also have the problem of food shortage to face.  So, it's because of the population growth, our health and our environment that we need to find an additional source of protein. 


Why Crickets?


Once you get over the ‘Eww gross’ factor, it becomes crystal clear that insects are going to be an integral part of our diet in the future.  The insect that is going to start this food revolution is the Cricket.  

Here’s Why:

Crickets are high in protein, actually having twice the amount of beef.  They are high in iron, calcium, magnesium, zinc and Vitamin B-12.  In fact, crickets are a complete protein, containing all nine essential amino acids.  And they taste pretty darn good too.

In addition to just being really good for you, crickets are much more efficient at converting food they eat in to usable protein, they require almost no water and they emit far less greenhouse gases (as demonstrated in the diagrams below).


If you still can’t get past the ‘Eww’ factor, consider this…you are already eating bugs…lots of them.  The average american eats an estimated 1-2 pounds of bugs each year, they just don’t know it.  The FDA allows insect fragments in practically all food.  So if you eat chocolate or peanut butter or drink coffee or beer, you are already passively eating insects.  We think it’s time for us to get active about eating insects, and in doing so, save ourselves and the planet.

 This is why we are going to, with your help, start a full-scale cricket farm.


Why this will work.


Crickets have been anointed the ‘Gateway Bug.' There are currently over 30 companies selling cricket based foods, and that number is growing rapidly.  Demand for crickets is outpacing supply.  We plan to help supply that demand by growing the best product possible in Vermont’s first cricket farm.


Why Vermont?


The State of Vermont, more than any other state, is positioned to be a perfect launching pad for this food revolution.  Crazy ideas like, knowing where our food comes from and embracing the fight against climate change are welcome here.  Vermont has also established itself as a powerhouse in the food and beverage arena.  What better way to wash down that delicious fried cricket than with a Heady Topper (or something from Hill Farmstead…or Lawsons…or any of the other amazing beers from Vermont)?  How about cricket-flour bread with some Bayley Hazen Blue?  And you know Ben and Jerry are going to come up with some crazy cricket ice cream.  In keeping with this tradition of excellence, we want to produce nothing but the best crickets possible.


Where is the money going?


Our goal is to raise enough money so that we can cover the initial cost of all of the equipment and warehouse space, as well as being able to operate for six months.

  The costs break down as follows:

  • Lease (6 months) : $26,700
  • Utilities : $3,000
  • Incubation Tent (for eggs and baby crickets) : $3,000
  • Grow out tent : $6,000
  • HVAC : $5,000
  • Walk-in Refrigerator : $8,000
  • Walk-in Freezer : $5,000
  • Cricket Containers : $5,000
  • Cricket 'Condos' : $1,000
  • Nutrition Testing : $1,000
  • Misc (including food and water containers, egg laying trays, cricket-proofing, initial food purchase etc) : $5,000
We are also looking in to the possibility of building a space.  This option would be more expensive up front, but would be much more cost effective overall.

If we are fortunate enough to raise over our goal of $70,000, we will use that additional money to further research and develop the most efficient way of farming crickets.


Starting a Movement


We appreciate any donation, large or small.  Every bit of support will get us one step closer to fulfilling our mission. But this isn't just about raising money.  The single biggest thing you can do is raise awareness.  The majority of people are unaware of the massive issues that go along with livestock production and their impact on us and our earth.  When we think about 'Climate Change,' we usually think about energy production and hybrid vehicles, not the food we eat.  Yet the food we eat is one of the single largest contributors to climate change, and is also the one which we have the most control over.
'Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results. (Albert Einstein)'  

Let's stop eating the same foods and expecting things to get better.  Let's avoid insanity by evolving how we look at food, for the good of our bodies and the future of our planet.  

Thank you for taking the time to read our story and please know how immensely grateful we are for your support.

story:
HELP US TO RAISE AWARENESS ON VITILIGO IN SELECTED SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA

Vitiligo is a very complex skin condition, characterised by a sudden loss of melanin in the skin, which turns it milky white in irregular patches.It affects one in every hundred people and can strike anyone at any time, often leading to depression and isolation. Complete knowledge of its etiology has proved elusive, despite decades of intense research. Vitiligo is a chronic, persistent and often progressive disorder - spontaneous repigmentation is uncommon. 

Most people remember Michael Jackson for his great musical talent and astounding star quality. However many people also judged him… for altering the colour of his skin.

The truth is Michael suffered from a condition that many people around the world also have – it’s called Vitiligo. This crowdfunding campaign has been put together to raise awareness and provide support for individuals living with Vitiligo in Sub-Saharan Africa, who struggle everyday with the same problem that MJ faced.

This campaign has been put together

  • To raise funds for Vitiligo awareness, provide enlightenment and create extensive Vitiligo awareness/enlightenment and education through promotion, marketing and positive PR.
  • To build capacity and structures and also inaugurate all partner groups of Vitiligo in Select Sub-Saharan Africa, where Vitiligo is still seen as being a curse, a frightening condition, nemesis, anger of the gods and a strange ailment. 
  • And to give seed funding and possibly stipends to coordinators/Executive Directors.

About Vitiligo

Vitiligo (pronounced vit-ill-EYE-go) is a generally unpredictable skin condition, which results in white patches appearing on the skin. While the exact cause of vitiligo is unknown, it has been confirmed that an autoimmune component plays a strong role in the condition. The chronic nature of the condition, long term treatment, lack of uniform effective therapy and unpredictable cause of the condition has a significant impact upon the quality of life of individuals living with vitiligo. It has a devastating effect on social life of the patient and their family.

Vitiligo is a life-long condition and it’s unlikely that you will ever be completely free of it. Vitiligo isn't contagious, so you can't catch it from other people or pass it on. Vitiligo tends to spread over time, often for no apparent reason. Vitiligo can begin at any age. 

By raising awareness of Vitiligo and the psychological and negative impact it has on individuals living with it and their families,  we hope to increase education and understanding and help as many people living with Vitiligo in and around West and Sub-Saharan Africa as possible.

Our target is to raise $200,000.                                                                                         Please we need you to support this campaign by making donations so we can achieve our target, goal and objectives:

  • Extensive Vitiligo awareness and enlightenment in selected African countries
  • Inauguration of Vitiligo Support groups/organisations within the selected countries, with a seed funding and stipends to run.
  • Capacity building and Positive image workshop for all the leaders of the Support groups/organisations.

Please donate what you can and help us achieve these goals.

As a charity we are constantly seeking support and funds to achieve our objectives. When we learned about Crowdfunding we felt all of our prayers had been answered. We truly believe that by opening our campaign up to the entire world, we can connect with individuals who emphatise with us, individuals living with Vitiligo, their family, friends and colleagues and also give you the chance to support and partner with our cause. 

Through crowdfunding we can share our message, raise funds and provide support for everyone that is living with Vitiligo beginning with our primary target area.

We need to raise $200,000 so that we can support all of our partner organisations and our network of non-profits. Many have been inspired by the Founders journey and are technically supported by VITSAF.

Every $ we raise will go towards our work, our partner organisations and our network, members and stakeholders. We have no major overheads, such as large offices, so you can rest assured every $ will be spent wisely.

Lets work together to reach our goals and change lives.

PLEASE:

  • Share this campaign online and through your social media platforms
  • Tell all of your friends and family and anyone you know who has Vitiligo about our mission
  • Follow us and provide support along the way with messages of encouragement
  • Promote the benefits of our work in your local community, and across Africa
  • Remember – PLEASE DONATE whatever you can
  • Purchase your supporters perks now – while they are available

We are always seeking new partners who wish to join us on our mission, so please contact us for more information on how to become a part of our network.

We have inspired and supported organisations working hard to uplift individuals living with Vitiligo across Sub-Saharan Africa, and if this is as important to you as it is to them, and us then you should join our community.

The countries and Vitiligo Support/organisations are

  • VITSAF Vitiligo Support Group, Ghana
  • VITSAF Vitiligo Support Group, Senegal
  • Beyond Vitiligo, South Africa
  • Vitiligo Society Kenya = VISOKE
  • Vitiligo Support Group Uganda
  • Vitiligo Support Group Namibia
  • Vitiligo Foundation Ethiopia
Meet some of our network members here:

Najukka Vivian

Founder/Coordinator, Vitiligo Support Group Uganda (VISIGU)

I wish to express my gratitude to VISTAF for its commitment and support, to the individuals living Vitiligo in Africa. 

MY EXPERIENCE WITH VITILIGO:

Every thing was perfect in my life until I was diagnosed with VITILIGO. I have been suffering from vitiligo for the last eleven years, it was really a distress the day it appeared on my face and put me into lot of stress. It was around June 2004 when I was finalizing with my first  Degree in Library and Information Science at Makerere University, Kampala – Uganda, when  I faced this Vitiligo  trauma. It was really a year of great life experience and challenges. My skin from no where started to react, changing from its original birth color uncontrollably especially in the focal parts of my body such as the ; face ,mouth, hair, arms and legs. This caused me a lot of stress as, I had never seen or heard of  this type of skin patches. What even caused me more stress is when I visited skin doctors who could not even know the name of my problem. It was not until I visited the Internet and did my own search that I came to know  the name of this skin patches. It was scientifically termed as VITILIGO.  

...they would just make fun of  me and say; Vivian that is AIDS and it has started on you in the face ,then others could make comments such as; Vivian that skin problem  has no medicine  and cure and it will not get  healed. Others would ask me ; If I think I will ever get married at all? I will also never forget one person who mocked me and said I was a good sacrifice. All such comments from different people and sources distressed me a lot, to the extent that I thought of committing suicide...


 

Enam Honya

Vitiligo Ambassador Ghana

Coordinator, VITSAF Vitiligo Support Group, Ghana

Living with Vitiligo in the locality I am, there's a lot of challenges, poor and nasty attitudes towards individuals with Vitiligo, discrimination, isolation, scary, nasty and unfriendly comments, some people attribute it to a curse and or spiritual means.

   

Gaone Pat Tihong 

Founder/Executive Director, Beyond Vitiligo

South Africa

There’s a misconception in rural areas that Vitiligo is caused by the mollo wa badimo fire of ancestors. 

Some people out there think that vitiligo is ancestors related and some don’t even know the importance of applying sunblock. Vitiligo can cause one to have emotional roll coaster and some vitiligans need a qualified therapist to talk to.

          

 Love Afezuke - Ghana

Virtual Coordinator, VITSAF Vitiligo Support Group Ghana

Accra, Ghana

...she interviewed  me and possibly didn't notice my white patches, so she accepted me for the work (ushering job) and I took the measurement for the customised wears and all that. The day of the event where I was supposed to be one of the ushers then she saw my patches, she couldn't hide her disappointment and she screamed, 'what is this you have on your body'?  Too much scars and flaws, we can't work with you please remove the clothes and go home. And in front of lots of people she made me take her clothes off and left, it was a very embarrassing, humiliating and discriminatory moment. I cried hard, felt really bad.... 

Such experience I do not wish any other, I am trying to do all I can to enighten and educate the public about Vitiligo. 

We need resources, skills and support throughout our journey. 

James Laban - Kenya

Founder/Executive Director.

Vitiligo Society of Kenya (VISOKE)

We as Kenyans suffer a lot of stigma due to public ignorance and we would like to put awareness and enlightenment creation as our number one issue. This we are planning to do by carrying such programs in schools and churches/mosques. There has been an inadequate fund for organizing the training of the trainers’ courses and logistics related to the same. 

In God we trust all will be well someday.

     Saara Nangula - Namibia

Founder/Coordinator, Vitiligo Namibia

I have lived with Vitiligo for eight years now, spots makes people to stare and I feel I am different to other people, people stare because they have no idea what Vitiligo is and if we educate people about this skin disorder then we will stop receiving that silly stares.

Please donate to this cause as the success will  assist us get some funds we will use towards the Vitiligo  education/enlightenment.


AtoTamru Kedir Ireso

Founder/Executive Director

Vitiligo foundation of Ethiopia

Individuals living with Vitiligo are called derogatory names, a lot of misconceptions as if Vitiligo occurs due to curse from ancestors evil deeds. Moreover, lack of sound knowledge on the condition has led to discrimination and stigma. Parents, families and communities are ashamed of explaining the condition when Vitiligo occurs on the body in Ethiopia. States and communities have consistently neglected and shunned vitiligo society in employment and education.

THE FOUNDING TEAM

Vitiligo Support and Awareness Foundation (VITSAF), is a not-for-profit, patient–driven, patient-advocate organization incorporated in Nigeria and passionately concerned about the Rights and Social Well-being of individuals living with Vitiligo, Altered images and skin imperfections primarily in Sub-Saharan Africa, helping ameliorate the agony people suffer as a result of turning from black to white. - See more at: http://www.vitsaf.org/vitiligo#sthash.FtGaByfJ.dpuf

THE FIRST ENCOUNTER WITH VITILIGO - Ogo Maduewesi, Founder VITSAF

My name is Ogo Maduewesi, an Ashoka Fellow, the Founder/Executive Director of Vitiligo Support and Awareness Foundation - VITSAF.

You never really know what is going to happen in your life, everything can be going along just fine and then out of nowhere everything changes in an instant. Sometimes, when we are faced with adversity, we discover a side of us that we may not have been aware of.

Truly before 2005, eyes turned in my direction only to appreciate my obvious natural beauty, all that began to change when I woke one morning in February that year looked at the mirror and discovered a patch around right side of my lip. I totally ignored it, thinking it was something that would roll off as it came. But as time went on, the parchment began to spiral to my chin, forehead and to the rest of the right side of my body, making it difficult for me to accept what I saw on looking at the mirror. A good part of the right side of my face and neck line showed white parchments that gave the impression of scars from fire burn. It was unimaginable that that was happening to me five clear years after I graduated. I took my case to dermatologists, who described the skin scourge as vitiligo, but did not seem to have a solution. And so, the strange visitor assumed permanent residency, as it were.

I became scared of life, my future and my dreams! I was scared of dying with my dreams; I hated being pitied...

- Ogo Maduewesi

Obiageli Ukeoma

VITSAF Vitiligo Support, Coordinator 

Lagos State, Nigeria.

Also Volunteer Admin/Finance VITSAF  

 It all started when I was small precisely in Junior Secondary School. That was 15 years back. I first noticed a white spot on my lip and it spread to the hands. As small as I was then, people accused me of kissing and smoking cigarette. As that wasn't enough, I was mocked and cajoled by my class mates. I grew up with Vitiligo spreading all over my body. I felt like committing suicide as I was accused of coming to the world the second time. Some said that I killed and ate python and all that. 

...So many people are dying in silence, committing suicide, being rejected by families and friends, relieved of their jobs, divorced to mention but a few. 


We would like to thank every contributor and supporter of VITSAF

Remember to share the project via social media, and for further information or to Contact us about your perks or for general information.

A Final Message from our Founder

What a ride it has been for our cause. Since our organisation’s initiation in Nigeria 6 years ago, we have been touching lives and renewing hearts of those diagnosed with Vitiligo, beginning in Africa.

The fire in my heart towards helping us all has not diminished after all these years, but now burns more than ever before when I see our actions impacting people from all walks of life.

Throughout the VITSAF existence we have managed to, despite all obstacles, improve the Quality of Life of patients, and enhance their self confidence. Through active outreach programmes and activities, we have shed new light and continue to inspire medical and personal attention to us, drastically changing their lives as they know it.

Please see more at: http://www.vitsaf.org/message-from-ogo-vitsaf#s...


Please support our campaign at www.vitsaf.org
story_txt:
HELP US TO RAISE AWARENESS ON VITILIGO IN SELECTED SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA
 
Vitiligo is a very complex skin condition, characterised by a sudden loss of melanin in the skin, which turns it milky white in irregular patches.It affects one in every hundred people and can strike anyone at any time, often leading to depression and isolation. Complete knowledge of its etiology has proved elusive, despite decades of intense research. Vitiligo is a chronic, persistent and often progressive disorder - spontaneous repigmentation is uncommon. 

Most people remember Michael Jackson for his great musical talent and astounding star quality. However many people also judged him… for altering the colour of his skin.
The truth is Michael suffered from a condition that many people around the world also have – it’s called Vitiligo. This crowdfunding campaign has been put together to raise awareness and provide support for individuals living with Vitiligo in Sub-Saharan Africa, who struggle everyday with the same problem that MJ faced.

This campaign has been put together



To raise funds for Vitiligo awareness, provide enlightenment and create extensive Vitiligo awareness/enlightenment and education through promotion, marketing and positive PR.


To build capacity and structures and also inaugurate all partner groups of Vitiligo in Select Sub-Saharan Africa, where Vitiligo is still seen as being a curse, a frightening condition, nemesis, anger of the gods and a strange ailment. 


And to give seed funding and possibly stipends to coordinators/Executive Directors.




About Vitiligo
Vitiligo (pronounced vit-ill-EYE-go) is a generally unpredictable skin condition, which results in white patches appearing on the skin. While
the exact cause of vitiligo is unknown, it has been confirmed that an
autoimmune component plays a strong role in the condition. The chronic nature of
the condition, long term treatment, lack of uniform effective therapy and
unpredictable cause of the condition has a significant impact upon the quality
of life of individuals living with vitiligo. It has a devastating effect on social life of the patient and their family.

Vitiligo is a life-long condition and it’s unlikely that you will ever be completely free of it. Vitiligo isn't contagious, so you can't catch it from other people or pass it on. Vitiligo tends to spread over time, often for no apparent reason. Vitiligo can begin at any age. 
   
 

By raising
awareness of Vitiligo and the psychological and negative impact it has on individuals living with it and their families,  we hope to
increase education and understanding and help as many people living with
Vitiligo in and around West and Sub-Saharan Africa as possible. 
Our target is to raise $200,000.                                                                                         Please we need you to
support this campaign by making donations so we can achieve our target, goal and objectives:


Extensive Vitiligo awareness and enlightenment in
     selected African countries


Inauguration of Vitiligo Support groups/organisations
     within the selected countries, with a seed funding and stipends to run.


Capacity building and Positive image workshop for all
     the leaders of the Support groups/organisations.





Please donate what you can and help us achieve these goals.

are constantly seeking support and funds to achieve our objectives. When we
learned about Crowdfunding we felt all of our prayers had been answered. We

cause.

Every $ we raise will go towards our work, our partner organisations and our network, members and stakeholders. We have no major overheads, such as large offices, so you can rest assured every $ will be spent wisely.

story: The money raised will be used to buy cold cots to give other families precious time with there babies. The cold cot at our local hospital in Wrexham was a lifeline to us and we want to provide cold cots for other hospitals and to help others make precious memories with there angels.

story:
The people of Africa have suffered for generations due to a lack of adequate medical care. Almost all aspects of healthcare that we in the United States find relatively easy to access are almost impossible to find in that part of the World.

One of the most serious causes of death and disability in Africa are trauma related conditions. Things like broken bones and injuries from car accidents and falls. Since many of the people in this region are subsistence farmers and laborers, any injury that leaves them unable to work usually results in terrible outcomes for the injured and their families. Once the breadwinner is hurt, without treatment and care, an entire circle of people can starve to death! There is no social welfare system to catch them in times of need.

Dr. Joe Marotta is an Orthopedic Surgeon and the head of Medicus Christi, Ltd., a nonprofit organization striving to bring up-to-date injury treatment to the poor and underserved on the African Continent. We aim to bring volunteers to care for devastating traumatic medical problems like broken bones and damaged limbs to people of all ages. Furthermore, we are planning to create training programs to teach the local people how to care for these injuries themselves. Together with the wonderful people of West Africa, we can join forces to make a huge impact.

In June of this year, Dr. Joe is making a fact finding and organizational trip to Ghana, West Africa to establish a relationship with a hospital in that country that is willing to host Medicus Christi’s efforts into the future. That hospital is located in the City of Sunyani which is in the Central Region of Ghana.

We need financial support to pay for this mission and to provide some initial medical supplies for those who need our help.

Please join us in this important work by making a donation to the "Send Dr. Joe to Ghana” Campaign.

story:
In August Ruth will cycle 2000 Kilometers through The Netherlands to collect funds for an organization in The Netherlands that supports children with muscle diseases by organizing events to make their life more enjoyable and by funding research to cure muscle diseases. These children can't live their life like normal children because their muscles do not function normally. Our muscles are healthy and we want to use our healthy muscles to support these awesome children.

I won't keep any of the money that I collect. All will go to the cause.
If you donate 100 euros or more, we will mention you on our Facebook page (Dutch) and on our action page (Dutch).

This Crowd funding campaign is here to allow my international supporters to support this cause and this event. If you are Dutch, you can donate directly to this event / Spieren voor Spieren via this link:
https://www.sportenvoorspieren.nl/actie/ruth-gabor

You can like this event on Facebook (Dutch) here:
https://www.facebook.com/2000kilometer

More perks may be added in the future.

story:
What is it?

One7days is on a mission to change the world. But we need your help!

We are building a brand new app to use the power of numbers to raise funds for global charities. Users will be able to download the app for free on their iOS or Android mobile device. Each week, one7days carefully selects a charitable project and if you want to, you can give one Dollar (or one Pound or one Euro).

It's very simple. The more people who get on board, the more money we can raise to transform the lives of people in need, and other worthy causes like environmental conservation, medical research and animal welfare as well as humanitarian issues. Imagine the impact we could make together if hundreds of thousands, even millions of people signed up.

Below are some examples of what the app will look like when a different charity project is highlighted once a week.

Our initial goal is to reach 100,000 downloads, and then with the help of our loyal users spreading the word, keep on growing and giving back. If each of those 100,000 users donated $1 per week this would result in:

· Over $4.2 million raised for charities in the first year alone.

What impact would this kind of money have? With the funds raised in just one week, some examples are:

· Help restore sight to 3,280 people suffering from preventable blindness

· Provide clean water to more than 23,000 people for 20 years

· Give 5500 families 250kg of food each over a three month period

· Provide 800 villages medicines to treat common illnesses & prevent disease

· Protect iconic creatures like the orang-utan, tiger and giant panda

· Much, much more...

Why do we need your help?

To date, we have already invested significant time and approximately $45,000 on this project, with 5 full-time, unbelievably dedicated staff working on one7days. The funds we have used thus far have been on salaries for 2 of the staff (the others are volunteers at this stage!) social media marketing campaigns and video's to promote our idea.  We are serious about this project, so serious that we have put up a lot of our own money to get it started because we believe so heavily in what we are doing.

What we need now is to begin the technical development of the one7days app. We personally cant afford to fund this ourselves, as much as we would love to have a bottomless pit of money, its just not possible.

We don’t want to have this AMAZING CONCEPT and LARGE SOCIAL MEDIA FOLLOWING and not be able to build the app. And this is why we desperately need your help!

In the table below it shows the specific funds required for each build (Android and iOS) as well as a website. We have engaged with our developers and the quotes equate to a little over what we are requesting.  We can’t start the build until we have the funds to do so.

Dollar Amount          

Where The Funds Will Be Distributed

$18,000

Android App Build

$18,000

iOS App Build

$10,000

Website Build

Total: $46,000

Our story

Having been an extremely successful business entrepreneur for many years, the founder of one7days; Amy Eade, decided it was time to pay it forward.  Volunteering in Bangkok to help a charity that supported orphans and those affected by the 2004 Boxing Day Tsunami, was a key event in Amy’s life that contributed to her decision to launch one7days.  Below is Amy with one of the children she helped while she was there.

Amy and her start-up team, Kate and Sarah, are no better, and will never claim to be, than other people who volunteer and donate to charities.  They are simply three women from Melbourne, Australia on a mission to make a difference in the world.

The one7days team have worked together on various projects for over 12 years. It all started during a conversation we had about some of the meaningful (and sometimes confronting) things we had collectively experienced in our adult lives. Things like witnessing people living in extreme poverty during our travels, being fortunate enough to see and learn about threatened species in the wild, adopting family pets from animal shelters, losing loved ones to incurable diseases like cancer and Alzheimer’s, and even having to explain to our own children the devastating images of war-ravaged countries that appear on the news on a daily basis.

It dawned on us that there are so many worthy causes in the world that need funding to help fight these seemingly endless battles, but many people either don’t make the effort, or simply cannot afford to donate to one, let alone all of them. I mean, where do you even start?

Many of us feel guilty that the small amount we can afford to give; be it $5, $20, or even $50, is not enough. So we put it off.

The simplicity of one7days can change all this.

We have found through market research that even people with very little disposable income not only want to and are willing to donate but they can comfortably afford $1 per week.


Project Timeline


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you’re able to contribute financially, we’d love for you to help us get the word out.  If you like what we’re doing, use the share tools at the top of this page to post a link to this project on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, your blog, or just tell your friends about us. 

Then you can say you were one of the first to join this world-changing social movement.
story_txt:
What is it?One7days is on a mission to change the world. But we need your help!We are building a brand new app to use the power of numbers to raise funds for global charities. Users will be able to download the app for free on their iOS or Android mobile device. Each week, one7days carefully selects a charitable project and if you want to, you can give one Dollar (or one Pound or one Euro).It's very simple. The more people who get on board, the more money we can raise to transform the lives of people in need, and other worthy causes like environmental conservation, medical research and animal welfare as well as humanitarian issues. Imagine the impact we could make together if hundreds of thousands, even millions of people signed up.Below are some examples of what the app will look like when a different charity project is highlighted once a week.Our initial goal is to reach 100,000 downloads, and then with the help of our loyal users spreading the word, keep on growing and giving back. If each of those 100,000 users donated $1 per week this would result in:· Over $4.2 million raised for charities in the first year alone.What impact would this kind of money have? With the funds raised in just one week, some examples are:· Help restore sight to 3,280 people suffering from preventable blindness· Provide clean water to more than 23,000 people for 20 years· Give 5500 families 250kg of food each over a three month period· Provide 800 villages medicines to treat common illnesses & prevent disease· Protect iconic creatures like the orang-utan, tiger and giant panda· Much, much more...Why do we need your help?To date, we have already invested significant time and approximately $45,000 on this project, with 5 full-time, unbelievably dedicated staff working on one7days. The funds we have used thus far have been on salaries for 2 of the staff (the others are volunteers at this stage!) social media marketing campaigns and video's to promote our idea.  We are serious about this project, so serious that we have put up a lot of our own money to get it started because we believe so heavily in what we are doing.What we need now is to begin the technical development of the one7days app. We personally cant afford to fund this ourselves, as much as we would love to have a bottomless pit of money, its just not possible.We don’t want to have this AMAZING CONCEPT and LARGE SOCIAL MEDIA FOLLOWING and not be able to build the app. And this is why we desperately need your help!In the table below it shows the specific funds required for each build (Android and iOS) as well as a website. We have engaged with our developers and the quotes equate to a little over what we are requesting.  We can’t start the build until we have the funds to do so.

story:
My name is Andrew D. Hyder 

 


Are you and your family STARVED for vital nutrients? According to the Journal of Human Nutrition and Dietetics and the University of Illinois, most people are lacking of many of the 91 essential nutrients that science tells us we need to eat everyday. According to the World Health Organization, chronic disease such as high blood pressure, diabetes and cancer are at epidemic growth rates, while at the same time the nutritional value of our food continues to decline. 

It's simple, fully nourished bodies fight disease better than malnourished bodies. Now imagine every essential nutrient the body needs in one delicious daily smoothie mix: Promanatein, a powder nutrient complex. Promanatein itself isn't the cure, with proper nutrition, your body is.

Why did I begin this journey? I believe that the human body was designed to intelligently use nutrients to maintain ideal health.  I believe that our immune system has the ability to avoid chronic disease when properly nourished.  

I asked myself these questions:

  • What are ALL the essential nutrients our bodies need for proper nutrition?
  • What happens when we don't get all the essential nutrients for many years?
  • Is there one product that contains every essential nutrient?

I found the answers to these questions:

  • There are 91 essential nutrients:  60 minerals, 16 vitamins, 12 amino acids and 3 fatty acids, and we need each of them EVERY day (that is why they are called essential). 
  • Not having these nutrients is the very definition of malnutrition. Long term, malnutrition means chronic disease is inevitable. 
  • I found no product that contains every essential nutrient. Therefore, I saw the need and opportunity to develop my own product - Promanatein.
Promanatein is every essential nutrient, in a convenient powder complex. It is tasty and perfect as a smoothie base or mixed in juice and water. It was designed to be eaten once per day in at least 8 ounces of liquid.  

Promanatein is non-GMO, gluten free, lactose free, vegan friendly, and made from mostly organic ingredients. It is fortified with nutrients from verified ultra pure sources.  It contains, all natural whole food and no preservatives . 

Our product label is still in the works, and should be available soon. 


There are 3 fundamental principles that drive our cause:

  1. All life exists as a result of intelligent design.
  2. Essential nutrients are the building blocks of life.
  3. By design, a reparative synergy occurs when all essential nutrients are present in the human body - at the same time.
... more info about our goals & philosophy are found at www.Promanatein.com


What We Need & What You Get

We need your support to help this cause. Even if you take a multivitamin, you are likely lacking essential trace minerals and unpopular important vitamins. Proper essential nutrients are critical: If you support us, your body will thank you and so will your family and friends. 

What we need:

  • We need to buy larger quantities of raw ingredients from our (non-GMO, gluten free and organic [where possible]) quality ingredient sources. 
  • Demand is greater than our capacity to fulfill, therefore we need to ramp up our production output from our current "friends and family" quantities, to production quantity levels.
  • We need to build our coupon referral marketing initiative. 
  • 100% of your help will go to further this cause and increase our production.



The Impact & The Perks

Imagine the difference we can make in people's lives as they start to become properly nourished. Most of them, (perhaps you or your loved ones) will for the first time in their lives experience every nutrient that our body (and our cells) need to adequately replicate and repair itself. 

This is my cause, and hopefully you share it. Lets help you. Lets help your family and your friends. We are so completely committed to you and your health, that if you join us, we will give you long term FREE supplies of Promanatein at every perk level.  Here are some of our Perk gifts:


(For further perk details see perk information on the right). 


Risks & Challenges

We know Promanatein will face obstacles and challenges. As a veteran entrepreneur (technology and the arts), I have experienced this. I never give up.  I was meant to spearhead this project, and it will be successful. 

Your help will expedite our growth. Without your support, it will simply take longer. The more we raise, the faster we can grow and the faster we help others. 

Already I have impacted my own health and that of my family and friends. This achievement was one of my important life goals.  Together, let's help other friends and families. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some people can't contribute funds, but that doesn't mean you can't help in one of the following ways:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Promanatein!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to support the cause.
  • Tell others our story on social media, like Facebook!

Thank you for your support.

Sincerely,

Andrew D. Hyder

story:
Palestinian Elderly Day Care Center in

Beit Sahour , Palestine

"My wife and I have visited and volunteered at this elderly center several times. I have a background in services to the elderly in the USA. I believe that this center is as good or better than similar centers in the USA. Hard times in the West Bank of Palestine make the continuation of this program difficult, while at the same time it is more and more needed because of the migration of the younger members of the families that this program serves. Your gift will help insure continuation of the services that are so critically needed.

David F. Johnson

Retired State Consultant to programs for the elderly and retired Executive Director of 4 retirement community and adult service centers.

Elderly Day Care Center

Elen Qassis, Executive Director of the Center, says

the "Elderly Care Center, is a non-profit, non-governmental organization located just next to Bethlehem in the town of Beit Sahour of the West Bank. The Elderly Care Center was established in 1984, and since 1997, has been under the direction of the Health Works Committee. The HWC and the Elderly Center management have tried to use all the necessary resources as well as recruit and invest all efforts to support and to advocate issues and present a distinct and enhanced model that promotes and improves the role of elderly in the Palestinian society. The Elderly Club also maintains the provision of recreational and cultural aspects according to the needs of its clients.

The activities and events carried out by the Club have echoed positively, leading to the involvement of all segments of the community in Beit Sahour. The Center’s mission is 'to promote upon the elderly a sense of joy in life and self-worth in the community during these difficult times of our history.' Our Center achieves this goal by providing a place of respite for over 150 of our community’s elderly. We provide for both the physical and social needs of our community’s elderly. For only 20 shekels (about $4.5) per month, the elderly can join us five days a week at the Center. Nutritious snacks are provided each morning, and at an additional charge of 4 to 6 shekels (about $1 to $1.50) per

day for lunch (optional). The Center also provides weekly health check-ups, health awareness programs, and exercise and fitness classes. In addition to providing services for the physical needs of our elderly, we also provide services to meet their social needs. The culture of Palestine is partly preserved here as we provide a place for the elderly to come together to practice our society’s traditions. The halls of the Center are filled daily with the songs and dances that are slowly slipping away from the consciousness of Palestinians. We take our elderly on day trips to social, religious, and educational sites around Bethlehem, provide weekly craft classes, allow for participation in social and religious events on certain traditional holidays, and run computer classes for beginners and intermediate users.

As health insurance is totally absent in Palestine, our health services are often the only ones that our community’s elderly receive. As the concept of government-provided social security is also completely absent here in Palestine, we alleviate some of the burden of the families of the elderly who often have very few resources to provide for them in their old age. Because of the economic and political problems the Palestinian people continue to face, our society also suffers. This suffering increases yearly, but the Center is one of the few places where those in greatest need in society, the elderly, can find solace and help."

The Director continues: " This request is to help with needed improvements to the facility that houses the center's programs. The total budget for this project is $29,500. This estimate is based on technical approach activities and inputs to be undertaken in accordance with the project proposal. This budget estimate includes all of the capital as well as directed costs associated with undertaking the formulation of the proposed project from its acquisition to implementation.

The funding request that we are now making is for one part of the total project. We are requesting a total of $2300 that will pay for waterproofing and insulation works, bituminous waterproofing membrane and sheet wall works. Anything that exceeds this goal will be applied to the other parts of the total project."

Что нам нужно и что вы получаете 

Закупить маты, новые сетки для баттутов, пружины, сделать ремонт подготовку к зиме.что можно купить на 1 $? очень мало но это большой вклад в хорошее дело или просто поделится этой ссылкой у себя на странице
